intro: Habenaria alpestris, commonly known as the alpine twayblade, is a terrestrial orchid native to the mountainous regions of Europe and parts of Asia. It is a small, herbaceous plant with a slender, leafless stem that typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters. The plant produces a single, erect flower with a distinctive, spurred lip that is often yellow or green in color. Its roots are adapted to thrive in well-drained, rocky soils at high altitudes. Habenaria alpestris is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in alpine meadows and grasslands.
